item.title: Top Russian Lawmaker: India-Pakistan Tensions Will Drive up Bitcoin Prices
item.description:
A senior Russian lawmaker says that intensifying tensions between India and Pakistan will spur a Bitcoin (BTC) price rise.

item.title: SOL Strategies Partners with Superstate to Pilot Solana Equity Tokenization on Surging Demand
item.description:
SOL Strategies has signed an MOU with Superstate to examine placing its listed shares on Solana via the Opening Bell platform. The initiative aligns with BlackRock’s $1.7 billion BUIDL expansion and Robinhood’s EU tokenized stock plans, boosting Solana’s role in compliant, real-time settlement.

The post SOL Strategies Partners with Superstate to Pilot Solana Equity Tokenization on Surging Demand appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: GENIUS Act Stalls After 49–48 Senate Vote, Stablecoin Framework in Limbo
item.description:
After bipartisan backing, the GENIUS Act has fallen 48-49 in the Senate, delaying a stablecoin rulebook and leaving oversight to states. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent says the setback dents dollar sway, while Democrats cite Trump’s $TRUMP gala and USD1-Binance deal as complicating factors.

The post GENIUS Act Stalls After 49–48 Senate Vote, Stablecoin Framework in Limbo appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: USD1 Stablecoin Blasts 1,540% to $2.1B – Will Trump-Tied Token Keep Its Peg?
item.description:
USD1 has grown from $128 m to more than $2.1 bn within days, driven by sizeable BNB-Chain mints and MGX’s agreement to use the token for a $2 bn Binance investment. Backed by WLFI, the dollar-pegged coin now ranks seventh by market cap, has drawn investors across Europe, Asia and Latin America, and has been listed fee-free on HTX.

The post USD1 Stablecoin Blasts 1,540% to $2.1B – Will Trump-Tied Token Keep Its Peg? appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Chinese Hackers Exploit SAP RCE Flaw CVE-2025-31324, Deploy Golang-Based SuperShell
item.description:
A China-linked unnamed threat actor dubbed Chaya_004 has been observed exploiting a recently disclosed security flaw in SAP NetWeaver.
Forescout Vedere Labs, in a report published today, said it uncovered a malicious infrastructure likely associated with the hacking group weaponizing CVE-2025-31324 (CVSS score: 10.0) since April 29, 2025.
CVE-2025-31324 refers to a critical SAP NetWeaver flaw

item.title: Qilin Ransomware Ranked Highest in April 2025 with 72 Data Leak Disclosures
item.description:
Threat actors with ties to the Qilin ransomware family have leveraged malware known as SmokeLoader along with a previously undocumented .NET compiled loader codenamed NETXLOADER as part of a campaign observed in November 2024.
"NETXLOADER is a new .NET-based loader that plays a critical role in cyber attacks," Trend Micro researchers Jacob Santos, Raymart Yambot, John Rainier Navato, Sarah Pearl

item.description:
Google on Thursday announced it's rolling out new artificial intelligence (AI)-powered countermeasures to combat scams across Chrome, Search, and Android.
The tech giant said it will begin using Gemini Nano, its on-device large language model (LLM), to improve Safe Browsing in Chrome 137 on desktops.
